TROPARION.Header: Troparion of the Prophecy in the 1<sup>st</sup> Tone

SEXTE.TROPARION: From enemies visible and invisible deliver us, O Lord, lest haply the heathen say: Where is their God? Let them understand, O Master, that Thou disregardest the sins of Thy people that repent.

PROKEIMENON.Header: First Prokeimenon of the Prophecy in the 1<sup>st</sup> Tone

SEXTE.PROKEIMENON: When the Lord hath turned back the captivity of His people.
When the Lord hath turned back the captivity of His people.
SEXTE.STICHOS: The fool hath said in his heart: there is no God.

PROKEIMENON.Header: Second Prokeimenon of the Prophecy in the 4<sup>th</sup> Tone

SEXTE.PROKEIMENON: O Lord, who shall abide in Thy tabernacle?
upon uprightness hath His countenance looked.
SEXTE.STICHOS: O Lord, who shall abide in Thy tabernacle?
